statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Colorado 82, South Dakota St 49
article.story: BOULDER, Colo. (AP) -- Andy Osborn scored 15 points and Richard Roby added 14 as Colorado routed independent South Dakota State 82-49 Monday night. Osborn was 5-for-9 on 3-pointers as Colorado (13-10) won for the third time in four games. The Buffaloes' most lopsided win of the year came two days after a 29-point loss to Kansas. Colorado allowed a season-low 49 points against South Dakota State (7-16). Steve Holdren led South Dakota State, a first-year Division I program, with 16 points. Ben Beran had 14. The Jackrabbits shot 35 percent and matched a season low in scoring in falling to 1-11 on the road. Substituting freely in the first half, Colorado shot 56 percent. With Roby scoring 12 points, Colorado built a 37-20 by halftime. The Buffaloes held the Jackrabbits scoreless for nearly four minutes to start the game. South Dakota State trailed by only 13-11 after baskets by Michael Loney and Beran with 12:10 left, but Colorado went on a 10-0 run to lead 23-11. Roby, 2-for-3 on 3-pointers, had his second to keep the lead in double figures over the last 4:35. Osborn had three 3-pointers to start the second half and when Marcus Hall drained a 3-pointer with 15:34 left, Colorado's lead grew to 54-28. South Dakota State connected on only 11-of-33 shots in the second half.
